justification: The paper discusses using 'test batteries aimed at assessing multiple cognitive abilities with multiple tasks for each ability' as a way to assess individual and species-level variation in primate cognition. This approach aims to capture shared variance across tasks related to the same cognitive ability.

The pilot study conducted as part of ManyPrimates focused on short-term memory, implementing a standardized memory task methodology across multiple sites to generate comparable data. The paper mentions the possibility for further data collection to include additional species for a more comprehensive analysis.
